title: Psalms Chapter 91 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Psalms chapter 91 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Psalms Chapter 91 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Psalms Chapter 91.

questions.question: Where shall he that dwelleth abide according to Psalms 91:1?
options: In the secret place of the most High
In the valley of the shadow of death
In the house of the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: In the secret place of the most High
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:1 states that he who dwelleth in the secret place of the most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.

questions.question: What does the psalmist say about the LORD in Psalms 91:2?
options: He is my refuge and my fortress
He is my light and salvation
He is my strength and shield
questions.correctAnswer: He is my refuge and my fortress
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:2 says, 'I will say of the LORD, He is my refuge and my fortress: my God; in him will I trust.'

questions.question: According to Psalms 91:3, from what shall God deliver you?
options: The snare of the fowler and noisome pestilence
questions.correctAnswer: The snare of the fowler and noisome pestilence
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:3 clearly states God will deliver from the snare of the fowler and from noisome pestilence.

questions.question: What will cover you according to Psalms 91:4?
questions.correctAnswer: His feathers
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:4 states, 'He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou trust.'

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 91:5 says you shall be afraid for the terror by night.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:5 says, 'Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night.'

questions.question: What does Psalms 91:6 say you shall not fear?
options: Pestilence that walketh in darkness and destruction at noonday
questions.correctAnswer: Pestilence that walketh in darkness and destruction at noonday
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:6 says you shall not fear pestilence in darkness nor destruction at noonday.

questions.question: According to Psalms 91:7, how many shall fall at your side?
questions.correctAnswer: A thousand
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:7 states that a thousand shall fall at your side, ten thousand at your right hand.

questions.question: According to Psalms 91:8, what will you see with your eyes?
questions.correctAnswer: The reward of the wicked
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:8 says you shall behold with your eyes the reward of the wicked.

questions.question: What must you make the LORD according to Psalms 91:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Your habitation
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:9 says, 'Because thou hast made the LORD, which is my refuge, even the most High, thy habitation.'

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Psalms 91:10: 'There shall no evil befall thee, neither shall any ______ come nigh thy dwelling.'
questions.correctAnswer: plague
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:10 states that no evil or plague shall come near your dwelling.

questions.question: Who does Psalms 91:11 say will be given charge over you?
questions.correctAnswer: His angels
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:11 says God will give His angels charge over you to keep you in all your ways.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 91:12 says angels will let you dash your foot against a stone.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:12 says the angels shall bear you up in their hands, lest you dash your foot against a stone.

questions.question: According to Psalms 91:13, what creatures shall you tread upon?
questions.correctAnswer: The lion and adder
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:13 says you shall tread upon the lion and adder; the young lion and dragon shalt thou trample under feet.

questions.question: Because he hath set his love upon me, what will God do according to Psalms 91:14?
options: Deliver him and set him on high
questions.correctAnswer: Deliver him and set him on high
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:14 states God will deliver him and set him on high because he has known His name.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 91:15 says God will answer those who call upon Him.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:15 says, 'He shall call upon me, and I will answer him.'

medium.title: Psalms Chapter 91 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Psalms Chapter 91 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Psalms 91, what biblical truth would you share about God's protection?
options: God is a refuge and fortress who delivers from danger
God's protection is only for the righteous priests
God's help comes only after we fix our mistakes
questions.correctAnswer: God is a refuge and fortress who delivers from danger
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:2 teaches that the LORD is a refuge and fortress in whom we can trust. Verses 3 and 4 affirm God's deliverance from snares and pestilence, covering us under His wings. This assures believers that God actively protects those who trust in Him.

questions.question: How does Psalms 91 describe the attitude a believer should have when facing fear and danger?
options: Do not be afraid of terror by night or arrows by day
Avoid all risks at any cost
Fear is a natural and unavoidable response
questions.correctAnswer: Do not be afraid of terror by night or arrows by day
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:5 encourages believers to reject fear of dangers both at night and by day. This verse teaches reliance on God's protection rather than succumbing to fear, promoting faith and courage in daily life.

questions.question: In the context of family life, how does Psalms 91 encourage believers regarding the safety of their household?
options: No evil or plague will come near your dwelling
You must build strong physical defenses
Safety depends on human effort alone
questions.correctAnswer: No evil or plague will come near your dwelling
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:10 promises that no evil or plague will come near the believer's home, indicating God's protective care over families who make Him their refuge (verse 9). This encourages trust in God's provision and guarding of the household.

questions.question: A believer struggling with temptation asks about perseverance. What encouragement does Psalms 91 offer regarding overcoming trials?
options: God will deliver and honor those who call upon Him
Trials are punishment for sin with no relief
Endurance depends on human strength alone
Avoid all difficulties to stay safe
questions.correctAnswer: God will deliver and honor those who call upon Him
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:15 promises God will answer those who call upon Him, be with them in trouble, deliver them, and honor them. This offers hope and encouragement for perseverance by trusting God's intervention.

questions.question: How does Psalms 91 teach about the role of prayer and God's response in times of trouble?
options: God will answer when we call upon Him
Prayer is only effective in public worship
God ignores the prayers of the troubled
Prayer must be accompanied by sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: God will answer when we call upon Him
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:15 clearly states that God will answer those who call upon Him and be present in their troubles. This emphasizes the power and importance of personal prayer and God's faithful response.

questions.question: What does Psalms 91 say about God's protection through angels, and how can this encourage a believer at work or in daily responsibilities?
options: God gives His angels charge to keep us in all our ways
Angels only protect holy places, not everyday life
Protection is only spiritual, not physical
We must rely on luck instead of angels
questions.correctAnswer: God gives His angels charge to keep us in all our ways
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:11 teaches that God commands His angels to guard believers in all their ways, including daily activities. This assures believers of divine protection in work and personal life, encouraging faith and diligence.

questions.question: According to Psalms 91, how should a believer view dangers such as 'the lion and the dragon'?
options: They shall be trampled underfoot by the believer
They are undefeatable and must be feared
Believers must flee from all dangers
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be trampled underfoot by the believer
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:13 metaphorically states that the believer will tread upon lions and dragons, symbolizing victory over dangers and evil through faith and God's power. This encourages courage and spiritual victory.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 91 assures us that making the LORD our refuge results in no evil or plague coming near us.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:9-10 affirm that because the believer makes the LORD their refuge, no evil or plague will come near their dwelling, highlighting God's protective promise.

questions.question: True or False: According to Psalms 91, God's truth acts as a shield and buckler for believers.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:4 states that God's truth shall be the believer's shield and buckler, symbolizing defensive protection through God's faithfulness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Psalms 91 says, 'He shall cover thee with his ______, and under his wings shalt thou trust.'
questions.correctAnswer: feathers
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:4 uses the imagery of feathers covering and protection under wings to illustrate God's care and refuge, encouraging trust in Him.

questions.question: How does Psalms 91 instruct believers to respond to the presence of widespread calamity around them?
options: They will witness the reward of the wicked but remain unharmed
They should isolate themselves from society
They must fight physically against all calamities
They will be destroyed like the wicked
questions.correctAnswer: They will witness the reward of the wicked but remain unharmed
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:7-8 explains that many may fall near the believer, but harm will not reach them; they will only see the wicked's punishment, teaching trust in God's protection amid adversity.

questions.question: How does the chapter encourage believers to approach God in humility and faith regarding their life span and salvation?
options: God will satisfy them with long life and show salvation
Life is uncertain and salvation is earned by deeds
God only grants long life to the wealthy
Salvation is a secret only few receive
questions.correctAnswer: God will satisfy them with long life and show salvation
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:16 promises God will satisfy the believer with long life and reveal His salvation, encouraging faith, humility, and gratitude for God's blessings.

questions.question: Based on Psalms 91, what is a practical way to live in daily obedience and trust in God's protection?
options: Making the LORD our refuge and habitation
Ignoring God's promises and relying on self
questions.correctAnswer: Making the LORD our refuge and habitation
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:9 emphasizes making the LORD our refuge and highest dwelling place as the foundation for trusting His protection and living obediently.

questions.question: How can a believer apply Psalms 91 in serving others within the church community?
options: Trusting God to protect as they faithfully serve and love
Avoid serving to protect themselves from harm
Serve only those who can repay them
questions.correctAnswer: Trusting God to protect as they faithfully serve and love
questions.explanation: The chapter's theme of God's protection (verses 11, 15) encourages believers to serve others confidently, relying on God's care while practicing love and obedience.

questions.question: What biblical virtue does Psalms 91 highlight when it says, 'Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him'?
options: Love and faithfulness to God result in deliverance
Love is irrelevant to God's protection
Deliverance comes by human effort alone
questions.correctAnswer: Love and faithfulness to God result in deliverance
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:14 teaches that God's deliverance is based on the believer's love and knowledge of His name, highlighting the importance of a loving, faithful relationship with God.

hard.title: Psalms Chapter 91 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Psalms Chapter 91.

questions.question: In Psalms 91:1, what does 'dwelling in the secret place of the Most High' metaphorically represent in the context of ancient Near Eastern imagery?
questions.correctAnswer: Seeking refuge under divine protection
questions.explanation: The phrase 'secret place of the most High' symbolizes intimate fellowship and divine protection, paralleling ancient Near Eastern concepts of a sacred sanctuary where one is safe from enemies (Psalms 91:1).

questions.question: Which literary device is predominantly used in Psalms 91:4, 'He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou trust'?
questions.correctAnswer: Metaphor
questions.explanation: The image of God covering with feathers and wings is a metaphor illustrating care and protection, common in Hebrew poetry to express divine shelter (Psalms 91:4).

questions.question: According to Psalms 91:3, from what two dangers does God promise deliverance?
options: The snare of the fowler and noisome pestilence
questions.correctAnswer: The snare of the fowler and noisome pestilence
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly mentions deliverance from the 'snare of the fowler' (a hunter’s trap) and 'noisome pestilence' (deadly disease), emphasizing God’s protection against physical and spiritual threats (Psalms 91:3).

questions.question: How does Psalms 91:5-6 use parallelism to emphasize the extent of God’s protection?
options: By listing dangers by time of day and type
By comparing God to a warrior
By repeating the phrase 'thou shalt not be afraid'
questions.correctAnswer: By listing dangers by time of day and type
questions.explanation: Verses 5 and 6 use synonymous parallelism, enumerating terrors by night and day, and pestilence in darkness and destruction at noon, to portray comprehensive divine protection (Psalms 91:5-6).

questions.question: What is the significance of the numerical contrast in Psalms 91:7, where 'a thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand; but it shall not come nigh thee'?
options: It emphasizes the believer's exceptional protection amidst widespread calamity
It predicts a literal battle with specific casualties
It refers to the population of Israel at the time
It symbolizes divine judgment on enemies
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes the believer's exceptional protection amidst widespread calamity
questions.explanation: The large numbers symbolize overwhelming danger around the believer, yet God’s protection prevents harm from reaching them, a motif of divine deliverance in scripture (Psalms 91:7).

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 91:11-12 allude typologically to angelic ministry, which is later referenced in the New Testament book of Hebrews concerning God's care.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:11-12 speaks of angels guarding the faithful, an idea echoed in Hebrews 1:14 where angels are described as ministering spirits sent to serve believers.

questions.question: In Psalms 91:13, the imagery of treading upon the lion, adder, young lion, and dragon can be interpreted as a foreshadowing of what biblical theme?
options: The exile and return of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Victory over evil forces
questions.explanation: The destructive animals symbolize evil powers; their defeat by the believer foreshadows divine triumph over evil, a theme developed in both Old and New Testament (Psalms 91:13).

questions.question: Which Hebrew term translated as 'refuge' in Psalms 91:2 conveys the idea of a stronghold or fortress in a military context?
questions.correctAnswer: Machseh
questions.explanation: 'Machseh' is the Hebrew word used for 'refuge' implying a place of protection like a fortress, reflecting the psalmist’s trust in God as a military stronghold (Psalms 91:2).

questions.question: How does Psalms 91:14-15 reflect an authorial intent to emphasize the covenant relationship between God and the faithful?
options: By promising deliverance and honor because of love and knowledge of God’s name
questions.correctAnswer: By promising deliverance and honor because of love and knowledge of God’s name
questions.explanation: These verses highlight God's response to the believer’s love and knowledge, indicating a relational covenant dynamic foundational in Hebrew theology (Psalms 91:14-15).

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'his truth shall be thy shield and buckler' in Psalms 91:4 in the context of ancient Near Eastern warfare imagery?
options: It symbolizes God’s faithfulness as a protective weapon
It refers to physical armor worn by soldiers
It is a metaphor for wealth and prosperity
It indicates the use of magical charms
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes God’s faithfulness as a protective weapon
questions.explanation: The shield and buckler are defensive weapons; 'truth' personified as these implies God’s steadfast faithfulness protects the believer from harm (Psalms 91:4).

questions.question: Psalms 91:10 states, 'There shall no evil befall thee, neither shall any plague come nigh thy dwelling.' How does this verse connect with the Passover narrative in Exodus 12?
options: Both depict divine protection from death and plague for the faithful
Both describe the building of an altar
Both focus on the establishment of the priesthood
questions.correctAnswer: Both depict divine protection from death and plague for the faithful
questions.explanation: The verse echoes the Passover theme where God spares the Israelites from plague, highlighting His protective covenant presence (Psalms 91:10; Exodus 12).

questions.question: Which New Testament passage most directly reflects the assurance given in Psalms 91:15, 'He shall call upon me, and I will answer him'?
options: Matthew 7:7 - 'Ask, and it will be given to you'
John 3:16 - 'For God so loved the world'
questions.correctAnswer: Matthew 7:7 - 'Ask, and it will be given to you'
questions.explanation: This New Testament promise of answered prayer parallels the Psalmist’s assurance of God’s responsiveness to the faithful (Psalms 91:15; Matthew 7:7).

questions.question: In Psalms 91:12, the phrase 'lest thou dash thy foot against a stone' employs what type of symbolic language common in Hebrew wisdom literature?
options: A metaphor for divine safeguarding against harm
questions.correctAnswer: A metaphor for divine safeguarding against harm
questions.explanation: The warning against dashing the foot symbolizes God’s protective care, a common wisdom motif for God’s guidance and preservation (Psalms 91:12).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Psalms 91:16 concludes with 'With long life will I satisfy him, and shew him my ____.'
questions.correctAnswer: salvation
questions.explanation: The verse ends with 'my salvation,' indicating God’s ultimate gift to the faithful (Psalms 91:16).

questions.question: True or False: The entire structure of Psalms 91 reflects a chiastic pattern emphasizing God’s protection as the central theme.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Scholars recognize Psalms 91’s chiastic structure, centering on divine protection imagery, enhancing its literary and theological impact (Psalms 91).

theological.title: Psalms Chapter 91 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Psalms Chapter 91 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Psalms 91:1, where does the one who dwells in the secret place abide?
options: Under the shadow of the Almighty
In the courts of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: Under the shadow of the Almighty
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:1 states that the one who dwells in the secret place of the Most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty, highlighting God's protective presence. This theme is echoed in Isaiah 25:4 where God is described as a refuge, and in John 10:28 where Jesus speaks of providing eternal security.

questions.question: In Psalms 91:2, how does the psalmist describe the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Refuge and fortress
questions.explanation: The psalmist declares the LORD as refuge and fortress, emphasizing God's protection and strength as a safe place for trust (Psalms 91:2). This aligns with Psalm 18:2 and 2 Samuel 22:3, where God is likewise described as a rock and fortress.

questions.question: What deliverance does God promise in Psalms 91:3?
options: From the snare of the fowler and noisome pestilence
questions.correctAnswer: From the snare of the fowler and noisome pestilence
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:3 promises deliverance from traps and deadly diseases, symbolizing God's protection from both physical and spiritual dangers. Similar deliverance is found in Exodus 15:26 and 2 Samuel 22:5, where God rescues from deadly peril.

questions.question: In Psalms 91:4, what metaphor is used to describe God's protection?
questions.correctAnswer: Covering with feathers and wings
questions.explanation: The metaphor of God covering with feathers and wings in Psalms 91:4 vividly portrays divine care and refuge. This is consistent with Ruth 2:12 and Matthew 23:37 where God's protective care is likened to a mother bird sheltering her young.

questions.question: According to Psalms 91:5-6, which of the following is NOT listed as a cause for fear?
questions.correctAnswer: Storms that shake the mountains
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:5-6 specifically mentions terror by night, arrows by day, pestilence in darkness, and destruction at noonday as things not to fear. Storms shaking mountains are not mentioned here but are a symbol of God’s power in Psalm 46:2-3.

questions.question: What promise is given in Psalms 91:7 regarding those around the believer?
options: Thousands will fall at your side and ten thousands at your right hand
You will conquer all your enemies
Your enemies will be turned to friends
questions.correctAnswer: Thousands will fall at your side and ten thousands at your right hand
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:7 promises that many around the believer will fall in judgment or calamity, but the believer will be preserved. This reflects God’s sovereign protection, seen also in Exodus 14:30 and Isaiah 54:17.

questions.question: What is the significance of 'Only with thine eyes shalt thou behold' in Psalms 91:8?
options: The believer witnesses the punishment of the wicked without harm
The believer will see visions of the future
The believer will gain wisdom to judge others
The believer will have spiritual enlightenment
questions.correctAnswer: The believer witnesses the punishment of the wicked without harm
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:8 indicates that the faithful will see the judgment upon the wicked but will not be harmed. This theme of divine justice and preservation aligns with Revelation 20:12 and Romans 12:19.

questions.question: According to Psalms 91:9-10, what results from making the LORD one's refuge?
options: No evil or plague will come near your dwelling
You will live without any trials
You will be wealthy and prosperous
questions.correctAnswer: No evil or plague will come near your dwelling
questions.explanation: The passage in Psalms 91:9-10 assures that those who make God their refuge will be shielded from evil and plague, emphasizing divine protection. This promise parallels Exodus 12:23 and Isaiah 43:2.

questions.question: What role do angels play according to Psalms 91:11-12?
options: They guard and protect the believer in all ways
They bring messages to the nations
They execute judgment on the wicked
They sing praises around God's throne
questions.correctAnswer: They guard and protect the believer in all ways
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:11-12 describes angels as guardians who protect believers from harm, carrying them to prevent injury. This is echoed in Hebrews 1:14 and Acts 12:7.

questions.question: What authority over dangerous creatures is given to the believer in Psalms 91:13?
options: Treading upon the lion and adder, trampling the young lion and dragon
questions.correctAnswer: Treading upon the lion and adder, trampling the young lion and dragon
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:13 promises victory over deadly beasts, symbolizing triumph over evil forces. Jesus affirms this authority in Luke 10:19, and Paul references it in Romans 16:20.

questions.question: What is the condition for God's deliverance stated in Psalms 91:14?
options: Setting his love upon God and knowing His name
questions.correctAnswer: Setting his love upon God and knowing His name
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:14 links deliverance to loving God and knowing His name, emphasizing relational faith over works. This corresponds with 1 John 4:16 and John 17:3.

questions.question: According to Psalms 91:15, how does God respond when the believer calls upon Him?
options: He answers, is with them in trouble, delivers and honors them
questions.correctAnswer: He answers, is with them in trouble, delivers and honors them
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:15 promises God’s responsive presence, deliverance, and honor when called upon. This is consistent with Psalm 34:17, Isaiah 41:10, and Romans 8:31.

questions.question: What ultimate blessing does God promise in Psalms 91:16?
options: Long life and showing His salvation
questions.correctAnswer: Long life and showing His salvation
questions.explanation: Psalms 91:16 concludes with the promise of satisfaction with long life and the revelation of salvation, reflecting God’s eternal blessing. Similar promises are in Proverbs 3:2 and John 3:16.

questions.question: How does Psalms 91 portray God’s truth in relation to the believer’s protection (Psalms 91:4)?
questions.correctAnswer: As a shield and buckler
questions.explanation: God’s truth is depicted as a shield and buckler in Psalms 91:4, emphasizing its defensive power for the believer. This metaphor is consistent with Ephesians 6:16 and Psalm 18:30.

questions.question: What eschatological hope is implicit in the protection and deliverance themes of Psalms 91?
options: God’s ultimate salvation and preservation of His people until eternity
questions.correctAnswer: God’s ultimate salvation and preservation of His people until eternity
questions.explanation: While Psalms 91 offers immediate protection, it points to ultimate salvation and eternal security in God, consistent with Revelation 7:15-17 and John 10:28-29.
